answerText: Lady Windermere's Fan, A Play About a Good Woman[10] Lady Windermere's Fan is a work by this author, who also wrote a comedy about the assumption of fictitious identities in The Importance of Being Earnest.
heading: MUT |2012 | 2 | 8 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The protagonist of this play shows the title object to Lord Darlington at a party. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play  in which the protagonist suspects her husband of having an affair. However, the "other woman," Mrs. Erlynne, turns out to be the protagonist's own mother.
